channel.title: cncf on Sergio Méndez Website
channel.description: Recent content in cncf on Sergio Méndez Website

item.title: Cloud Native and CNCF Projects, CNCF Students. Guatemala/India
item.description:
I hosted and speak in a live streaming for CNCF Students in Spanish, my students present the concepts of Cloud Native, CNCF projects, and how to start contributing. Online Event.

Event Link |

item.title: Creating Containers with Containerd, CNCF Students. Guatemala
item.description:
I hosted and speak in a live streaming for CNCF Students in Spanish, one of my students Leonel Aguilar presented a quick introduction to Containerd. Online Event.

Event Link |

item.title: Cloud Native - Cloud Native Students Day URACCAN, Nicaragua
item.description:
This talk was about Cloud Native, it explains the theory behind and how CNCF is involved in the state of art of Open Source projects in the context of cloud native. This talk was presented on Cloud Native Students Day URACCAN, Nicaragua. Online event.

Event Link | Slides

item.title: Realtime COVID-19 Display System using Service Meshes, CNCF Students
item.description:
The students of USAC, university of Guatemala presented a project about a high concurrency system that displays real time information about Covid-19, this project used Cloud Native technologies such as Kubernetes, Linkerd, gRPC, Prometheus and others. Charles Pretzer from Linkerd Community and Field Engineer of Buoyant, helped us answering questions and promoted students to Join the Linkerd Community. This was one of many sessions that try to involve students into the CNCF ecosystems, we also promoted the hashtag #cncfstudents to share students work on the social networks, my role was to organize the event and help the students to present the project to the linkerd people.

Event Link | Slides| Project Description

item.title: How USAC university students use Linkerd in the Operating Systems course, Linkerd
item.description:
I shared with the Linkerd Community how we are experiment with Linkerd for the Operating Systems course in our final students project.

  • Minute: 37:40

Linkerd Community Meetup Link| Project Description
